what: Load Columbia County HUC12 watersheds layer from Geoserver
title: nrcs-practices
code: columbia_huc12_url <- "http://142.93.92.104:8080/geoserver/Columbia/ows?service=WFS&version=1.0.0&request=GetFeature&typeName=Columbia:all_columbia_huc_12s&outputFormat=application/json"  # Convert GeoJSON to an sf object # drop geometry, we only need watershed names here columbia_huc12s <- geojson_sf(columbia_huc12_url) %>%     sf::st_drop_geometry() %>%     distinct(hc12_name,huc12)

title: nrcs-practices
text: Dataset provided SCC many unique watersheds file? Warning: Practice code 430 > 1 practice names . Filter NRCS data include HUC12 Columbia County many Huc12s Columbia County?
code: data_path <- system.file("extdata", "20040101-20240430 NRCS Practices_edited_v3.xlsx", package = "middlesnake")  nrcs_data <- readxl::read_xlsx(data_path) %>%   janitor::clean_names() nrcs_data %>%     pull(huc12) %>%     unique() %>%     length() #> [1] 1289 nrcs_data %>%     cnt(practice_code,n_distinct_vars = practice_name) %>%     filter(n_practice_name>1) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   practice_code n_practice_name     n n_cumulative #>   <chr>                   <int> <int>        <int> #> 1 430                         2  1106       105975 nrcs_data %>%     filter(practice_code==430) %>%     distinct(practice_name) #> # A tibble: 2 × 1 #>   practice_name               #>   <chr>                       #> 1 Irrigation Pipeline         #> 2 Irrigation Water Conveyance nrcs_columbia <-  nrcs_data %>%   filter(huc12 %in% columbia_huc12s$huc12 ) %>%   rename(same_code=land_unit_has_multiple_instances_of_same_practice_code,          same_code_and_year=land_unit_has_multiple_instances_of_same_practice_code_applied_the_same_year) nrcs_columbia %>%   cnt(n_distinct_vars = huc12) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   n_huc12     n n_cumulative #>     <int> <int>        <int> #> 1      36 13516        13516

title: nrcs-practices
text: practice code applied multiple times land unit year, data likely duplicated removed summing applied amounts -NRCS Conservation Practices Data: Overview FAQs Oct-2024 land_unit_id 1 distinct huc12 Columbia County Columbia County 9084 distinct records land_unit_id,applied_year, practice_code Check distinct records land_unit_id,applied_year, practice_code match distinct applied_amount, land_unit_id,applied_year, practice_code listings
code: nrcs_columbia %>%     cnt(land_unit_id,n_distinct_vars = huc12) %>%    filter(n_huc12>1) #> # A tibble: 0 × 4 #> # ℹ 4 variables: land_unit_id <chr>, n_huc12 <int>, n <int>, n_cumulative <int> nrcs_columbia %>%     cnt(n_distinct_vars = c(land_unit_id,applied_year,practice_code)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 6 #>   n_land_unit_id n_applied_year n_practice_code n_land_unit_id_applied_y…¹     n #>            <int>          <int>           <int>                      <int> <int> #> 1           2408             21             112                       9084 13516 #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​n_land_unit_id_applied_year_practice_code #> # ℹ 1 more variable: n_cumulative <int> nrcs_columbia %>%     cnt(n_distinct_vars = c(land_unit_id,applied_amount,applied_year,practice_code)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   n_land_unit_id n_applied_amount n_applied_year n_practice_code #>            <int>            <int>          <int>           <int> #> 1           2408             1146             21             112 #> # ℹ 3 more variables: #> #   n_land_unit_id_applied_amount_applied_year_practice_code <int>, n <int>, #> #   n_cumulative <int> duplicated_practices <- nrcs_columbia %>%     group_by(land_unit_id,practice_code,applied_year) %>%     mutate(duplicates_id_yr_code=1:n()) %>%     ungroup() %>%     group_by(land_unit_id,practice_code,applied_year,applied_amount) %>%     mutate(duplicates_id_yr_code_amt=1:n()) %>%     ungroup() ids_where_amt_is_different <- duplicated_practices %>%      filter(duplicates_id_yr_code>1) %>%      filter(!duplicates_id_yr_code==duplicates_id_yr_code_amt) %>%      pull(land_unit_id) %>%      unique() duplicated_listings <- duplicated_practices %>%     filter(land_unit_id %in% ids_where_amt_is_different) %>%     select(land_unit_id,practice_name,applied_amount,applied_date,applied_year,starts_with("dup"), program) %>%     arrange(land_unit_id,applied_year)%>%     split(~land_unit_id)

title: nrcs-practices
text: Note: Consider applied_amount program removing/collapsing duplicates land_unit_id,applied_year, practice_code

what: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
text: function reads Excel file containing NRCS practice data, standardizes column names, checks whether user-supplied HUC12 watershed codes present, flags duplicated practice entries, returns cleaned, dataset total applied amounts per group.

title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
text: dataset_path character string indicating path .xlsx Excel file read. huc_12_codes character vector HUC12 watershed codes verify dataset.

title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
text: data.frame containing: Cleaned standardized variable names Duplicate detection variables: duplicates_id_yr_code, duplicates_id_yr_code_amt Duplicated rows, representing unique land_unit_id–practice_code–applied_year applied_amount updated reflect total grouped duplicates

title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data
text: Duplicate records defined two stages: land_unit_id, practice_code, applied_year (duplicates_id_yr_code) fields plus applied_amount (duplicates_id_yr_code_amt) applied_amount  different values sameland_unit_id, practice_code, applied_year, applied_amount summed applied_amount  multiple values land_unit_id, practice_code, applied_year, records considered true duplicates removed original dataset names cleaned lowercase snake_case using janitor::clean_names().

title: Clean and Consolidate Duplicated NRCS Practices Data — clean_nrcs_data

what: Load a vector (WFS) or raster (WCS) layer from GeoServer — get_geoserver_layer
title: Load a vector (WFS) or raster (WCS) layer from GeoServer — get_geoserver_layer

code: get_geoserver_layer(   layer_name,   workspace = "Columbia",   base_url = "geoserver.megaloptera-data.com/geoserver",   raster = FALSE )

title: Load a vector (WFS) or raster (WCS) layer from GeoServer — get_geoserver_layer
text: layer_name Name layer (without workspace prefix) workspace Workspace name (default: "Columbia") base_url Base WFS URL (default: Columbia GeoServer endpoint)

title: Load a vector (WFS) or raster (WCS) layer from GeoServer — get_geoserver_layer
text: sf object representing requested vector layer, NULL warning request fails.

title: Load a vector (WFS) or raster (WCS) layer from GeoServer — get_geoserver_layer

what: Download and parse GIS features from an ArcGIS REST GeoJSON URL — get_gis_from_url
title: Download and parse GIS features from an ArcGIS REST GeoJSON URL — get_gis_from_url
text: function queries ArcGIS REST FeatureServer MapServer URL returns GeoJSON, optionally filters using SQL clause, loads result sf object. Look REST API documentation url layer find acceptable variable names query. Optionally, features can saved Shapefile current working directory.

title: Download and parse GIS features from an ArcGIS REST GeoJSON URL — get_gis_from_url
Download and parse GIS features from an ArcGIS REST GeoJSON URL — get_gis_from_url
text: url Character. full ArcGIS REST API query URL returning GeoJSON (must include f=geojson). save_as Optional character. Base file name (without extension) save result Shapefile. .shp extension added automatically. File saved working directory. Optional character. SQL-like clause filter features server (e.g., "County = 'Columbia'"). URL-encoded appended replace existing =.

title: Download and parse GIS features from an ArcGIS REST GeoJSON URL — get_gis_from_url
text: sf object parsed features.

title: Download and parse GIS features from an ArcGIS REST GeoJSON URL — get_gis_from_url
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Download all features and save to shapefile get_gis_from_url(   url = "https://geodataservices.wdfw.wa.gov/arcgis/rest/services/MapServices/EasternWashingtonPastures/MapServer/1/query?where=1=1&outFields=*&returnGeometry=true&f=geojson",   save_as = "pastures_all" )  # Filter by attribute and load only get_gis_from_url(   url = "https://geodataservices.wdfw.wa.gov/arcgis/rest/services/MapServices/EasternWashingtonPastures/MapServer/1/query?outFields=*&returnGeometry=true&f=geojson",   where = "County = 'Columbia'" ) } # }

what: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
text: function downloads Watershed Boundary Dataset (WBD) HUC polygons given county Washington clips HUC polygon county provided. Optionally saves results shapefile. Clipped acres watershed automatically recalculated added Acres_in_huc variable

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
code: get_huc_by_county(   county_name,   huc_level = "huc12",   save_shp = FALSE,   shp_path = NULL )

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
text: county_name Character. Name county (e.g., "Columbia"). huc_level Character. One "huc8", "huc10", "huc12". Default "huc12". save_shp Logical. Whether save result shapefile. Default FALSE. shp_path Character. File path save shapefile (without extension). Default NULL.

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
text: sf object watershed polygons assigned input county.

title: Load Washington HUC Watersheds by County — get_huc_by_county
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   asotin_huc12s <- get_huc_by_county("Asotin",  huc_level = "huc12")    leaflet() %>%   addTiles() %>%   addPolygons(data=asotin_huc12s,label=~name)   get_huc_by_county("Asotin",  huc_level = "huc12",  save_shp = TRUE,  shp_path = "../../../Documents/asotin_huc12_clipped")  } # }

text: county_names Character vector. One county names (e.g., "Columbia", "Walla Walla"). save_path Optional character. Directory output Shapefile saved. merged Shapefile saved swifd_<joined_counties>.shp inside directory.

title: Statewide Washington Integrated Fish Distribution — get_swifd_by_county
text: sf object SWIFD features clipped specified counties.

title: Statewide Washington Integrated Fish Distribution — get_swifd_by_county
text: function: Uses {tigris} get Washington county boundaries. Downloads full SWIFD dataset GeoJSON format via {httr}. Parses JSON using {geojsonsf}. Clips union selected counties, applying small buffer capture stream overlaps. Optionally writes result disk Shapefile.

title: Statewide Washington Integrated Fish Distribution — get_swifd_by_county

what: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
text: Summarize Acres Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds

title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
code: summarize_acres_by_huc12(   huc12,   overlay,   huc_id_col = "huc12",   group_vars = NULL )

title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
text: huc12 sf object representing HUC12 watersheds overlay sf object representing layers summarized (e.g., wetlands) huc_id_col name column identifying HUC12 unit (default: "huc12") group_vars Optional character vector additional grouping columns overlay layer (e.g., c("wetland_type"))

title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
text: data frame summarizing acres HUC12 optional groupings

title: Summarize Acres of Overlay Features within HUC12 Watersheds — summarize_acres_by_huc12
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  huc12 <- get_geoserver_layer("all_columbia_huc_12s") geohazards <- get_geoserver_layer("columbia-geologic-hazard")  geohaz_acres <- summarize_acres_by_huc12(huc12 = huc12, overlay = geohazards, group_vars = "forpehrtdc") } # }
